com.budjb.requestbuilder
[Groovy] Class UriBuilder

java.lang.Object
  com.budjb.requestbuilder.UriBuilder

class UriBuilder

Convenience wrapper around JSR311's UriBuilder that provides a groovy-like builder syntax. The class can be used in 3 ways: Builder-style ------------- URI uri = UriBuilder.build { host = 'www.example.com' path = ['resource', someVariable, 'view'] port = 80 scheme = 'http' } Object-style ------------ UriBuilder builder = new UriBuilder() builder.host = 'www.example.com' builder.path = ['resource', someVariable, 'view'] builder.port = 80 builder.scheme = 'http' Uri uri = builder.build() Template-style -------------- Uri uri = UriBuilder.build('http://www.example.com/resource/{var1}/view', someVariable) Notes ----- The class has a propery named base. When set via the builder syntax or object syntax, the uri will be parsed first, and then any other properties will override those values parsed from the uri, except for path which will add to it. As an example: URI uri = UriBuilder.build { base = 'https://www.example.com:8080/old/path' host = 'foo.bar' path = ['new', 'path'] scheme = 'http' port = 8081 } This code will result in the URI: http://foo.bar:8081/old/path/new/path.
